parts.text: {"word":"holdup","priority":"★★☆","meanings":[{"part_of_speech":"noun","definition":"強盗、襲撃","english_definition":"a robbery, especially one involving the threat of violence.","examples":[{"sentence":"There was a holdup at the bank this morning.","translation":"今朝、銀行で強盗事件がありました。"},{"sentence":"The gas station was the scene of a holdup last night.","translation":"昨夜、そのガソリンスタンドで強盗事件が発生しました。"}],"collocations":["bank holdup (銀行強盗)","armed holdup (武装強盗)","stage a holdup (強盗を企てる)","holdup man (強盗犯)"],"synonyms":["robbery","theft","raid","stickup (slang)"],"antonyms":[]},{"part_of_speech":"noun","definition":"遅延、妨害、停滞","english_definition":"a delay or obstruction.","examples":[{"sentence":"There's been a holdup on the highway due to an accident.","translation":"事故のため、高速道路で遅延が発生しています。"},{"sentence":"The project is experiencing holdups due to lack of funding.","translation":"資金不足のため、プロジェクトは停滞しています。"}],"collocations":["traffic holdup (交通渋滞)","production holdup (生産の遅延)","construction holdup (建設の遅延)"],"synonyms":["delay","obstruction","stoppage","hindrance","bottleneck"],"antonyms":["advance","progress","expedition"]},{"part_of_speech":"verb","definition":"(強盗などが)～を襲う、～を脅迫する","english_definition":"to rob or threaten, especially with a weapon.","examples":[{"sentence":"Two masked men holdup the store.","translation":"2人の覆面をした男が店を襲った。"},{"sentence":"They were holdup at gunpoint.","translation":"彼らは銃で脅迫された。"}],"collocations":["holdup a bank (銀行を襲う)","holdup a store (店を襲う)","holdup at gunpoint (銃で脅迫する)"],"synonyms":["rob","threaten","assault","stick up (slang)"],"antonyms":[]}],"etymology":{"value":"「hold up」という句動詞から派生。19世紀後半に、強盗が「手を上げろ (hold your hands up)」と命令することに由来する。","priority":"★★☆"},"pronunciation":{"ipa":"/ˈhoʊldˌʌp/","syllables":"hold-up"},"inflection":{"noun_plural":"holdups","verb_forms":{"present_simple":["holdup","holdups"],"past_simple":"holduped","past_participle":"holduped","present_participle":"holduping"}},"usage_notes":{"explanation":"「**holdup**」は、名詞としては主に「強盗」または「遅延」の意味で使用されます。動詞としては、主に口語で「強盗する」という意味で使用されます。名詞の「強盗」の意味では、特に暴力的な脅威を伴う強盗を指すことが多いです。名詞の「遅延」の意味では、交通渋滞やプロジェクトの遅延など、様々な状況で使用されます。動詞の「強盗する」の意味では、しばしば「holdup at gunpoint」のように、脅迫の手段を伴って使用されます。","priority":"★★★"},"common_mistakes":{"examples":[{"incorrect":"✗ The holdup was very late.","correct":"✓ The holdup caused a long delay.","note":"「holdup」は遅延そのものではなく、遅延を引き起こす原因となる出来事を指します。遅延の程度を表す場合は、「long delay」のように表現します。"},{"incorrect":"✗ He was holdup by the police.","correct":"✓ He was held up by the police.","note":"動詞として使用する場合は、「held up」が正しい過去形です。「holduped」も文法的には正しいですが、一般的ではありません。"},{"incorrect":"✗ The traffic was holdup.","correct":"✓ The traffic was held up.","note":"交通が遅延している状態を表す場合は、「The traffic was held up」のように受動態を使用します。"}],"priority":"★★☆"},"related_words":{"derivatives":["hold up (句動詞: 持ち上げる、耐える、遅らせる、強盗する)"],"idioms_phrases":["be held up (遅れる、妨げられる)"],"priority":"★★☆"},"level_frequency":{"CEFR":"B2","frequency_google_ngram":"比較的低頻度 (Relatively low frequency)","priority":"★☆☆"},"readability_explanation":{"level":"B2","text":"「**holdup**」は、主に2つの意味を持つ名詞です。1つ目は「強盗」で、特に暴力的な脅威を伴うものを指します。例えば、「銀行強盗」は "bank holdup" と言います。2つ目は「遅延」や「妨害」で、交通渋滞やプロジェクトの遅延などを指します。動詞としては、「強盗する」という意味で使われますが、名詞ほど一般的ではありません。日常会話よりも、ニュース記事や犯罪小説などでよく見かける単語です。"},"example_sentences":[{"sentence":"The police are investigating the bank **holdup**.","translation":"警察は銀行強盗事件を捜査している。","type":"noun","meaning_category":"強盗"},{"sentence":"We experienced a significant **holdup** due to road construction.","translation":"道路工事のため、大幅な遅延が発生しました。","type":"noun","meaning_category":"遅延"},{"sentence":"The robbers **holdup** the security guard at gunpoint.","translation":"強盗犯たちは警備員を銃で脅迫した。","type":"verb","meaning_category":"強盗する"},{"sentence":"I was **held up** in traffic and arrived late for the meeting.","translation":"交通渋滞で遅れて、会議に遅刻しました。","type":"idiom (be held up)","meaning_category":"遅れる"}]}
